column4: have you tried killing the process before attempting to oepn up eclipse again?
I did, then it worked again until I switched programs a couple of times, then it happened again.
when switching applications, are you choosing 'Show Desktop' as well?
there is a known bug there
I did once, but not when it happened for the first couple of times
use the very rarely.
are you using ubuntu 12.04?
yep, 12 anyways, installed a couple of days ago
hmm I'm not sure if this is the same bug i faced in 11.10 which wouldn't show the application at all when I tried to open it AFTER using 'show desktop'
try removing your installation of eclipse and installing it manually from eclipse.org
have you noticed this with other applications?
really? shouldn't the ubuntu software center installation work better?
no, not yet
now I unpinned it from the launcher, killed it again and started again. It started, but doesn't show in the launcher... somethings wrong here
is this an ungrade from 11.10?
no, fresh installation.
Yeah remove eclipse and download a newer version of it from eclipse.org

since it only seems to be eclipse that's acting this way you probably should try a different version. I've had quite a few issues with eclipse lately as well so this might be just another one of them.
ok, I'll try, however, I thought the ubuntu software center stuff should be working smoother with ubuntu than the stuff downloaded elsewhere? Isn't that the case generally?

the USC don't _always_ have the latest repos of the software. What I've noticed with eclipse is that when ever there is a new version of Ubuntu, eclipse gets the latest update then. After that you have to update it through their repos (i.e. Help > Check for updates) Sometimes that doesn't work either. So a fresh install is needed.
thanks, I'll try, maybe tomorrow, it's already late and I just need to check some code, should work for now... thanks.
np
